Keywords: Acolytes , Brotherhood of Mutants , Hellfire Club , Quiet Council , Ruler , Utopia , X-Men
Real Name: Max Eisenhardt
Special Powers
SAFE FROM CHARLES' REACH: SAFEGUARD: Mind Control, Penetrating/Psychic Blast
MAGNETIC FIELD: Energy Shield/Deflection, Sidestep. Regeneration, but only if Magneto occupies a square with a debris marker. // Modify Magneto's combat values by +1 if he is within 4 squares of a debris marker.
THE MASTER OF MAGNETISM: Telekinesis. // At the beginning of your turn Magneto may destroy a square of blocking terrain within range.
MAGNETIC SHIELD: Invulnerability, Willpower. // Opposing characters within range halve their range value.

Comments
September 10, 2021
Maxphyte
Just used this figure and while he plays differently from the original, I think I like this new one a lot more. Way easier to keep his buffs and has a lot more staying power because of his regeneration. His range deterrent is still great and the added Sidestep makes him a lot more mobile than the original.
September 2, 2021
saturnflight
Mattlikethepaint, that's not how Unique Modifier is used in HeroClix. Unique Modifier means "X copies of this character will only apply this modifier once". Magneto gets a flat +1 from this ability.
August 20, 2021
JDub
Man it’s tough, I keep going back and forth between this one and the old one. The old one is still good. I think what I miss the most about the old one on this one is being able to carry 4 characters. Losing the two attacks kind of sucks but in Modern I don’t feel it’s that big of a deal seeing you don’t have the dumpster or generator. I like the willpower, how it’s easier to get the +1 from debris, and that he cuts the range in half of opposing figures in his range not just ones targeting him so he helps out the whole team.
August 14, 2021
DrStupid
[QUOTE=Mattlikethepaint;12149530]It doesn't seem to say Unique Modifier or anything but does he really get +3 to all his stats if he's within 4 squares of 3 debris tokens? That's so good[/QUOTE] I doubt it. My guess is, if the effect would stack as you speculated it might, they would word it to be something like: "For each debris market within 4 squares of Magneto, increase Magneto's combat values +1." Again, just my guess as to their intent of the power. Still, this is a very potent Magneto, even if he does cost 175. Especially given his natural range, coupled with his SP Magnetic Shield to cut opposing figure range in half. And given you can surround him with up to 5 meatshields in the form of the new Hellfire Club Guards. Overall I love bringing this figure back into relevance. This, for me, is arguably one of the best scultps WK ever produced. And one of the select few pre-oreo base figures I still own.
July 29, 2021
Mattlikethepaint
It doesn't seem to say Unique Modifier or anything but does he really get +3 to all his stats if he's within 4 squares of 3 debris tokens? That's so good
June 23, 2021
bam
I for one am excited to play this Magneto. As much as I also miss the dual TK attacks, I can also appreciate the effect that extends how close Magneto has to be to debris to boost his stats. Not many characters can boost their damage easily thanks to the rule change. At least you still have some options. If you can get your hands on the dial, you may still play the AOA Magneto in golden if you want a Magneto that can do multi attacks. Likewise you could play this Magneto in golden age at 189 with the original ability. Also this legacy card allows for this dial to join the X-Men... which is HUGE.
June 20, 2021
brainiacFTW
It's sad cause this is one of my favorite Magnetos ever, but without the ability to make two powered-up object attacks in a turn I just don't like him.
June 11, 2021
Redrover454
Give him Kobik's cosmic cube and he'll have a 13 range with IT Hindering and Elevated.
June 11, 2021
Buckwheat
The combat values (besides range), in today's game, are underwhelming. I think that you'll have to have ample debris, for him to pull his weight.
